description: Create an Oracle HCM Cloud Instance to connect  your existing application to Human Capital Hub , allowing you to manage all your HCM activities across multiple Human Capital Elements. You will need your Oracle HCM Cloud account information to add an instance.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query.Simple Comparisons ('=','!=','>','<','>=','<=','AND') are supported. For example where=PersonId>=300000047632120 and PersonId<300000047632125 and FirstName='Kevin'

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand child objects.A valid expand query would be : SalutationLOV,roles.RoleGUIDLOV. To expand all child objects use 'all'.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specify the fields to return in the response payload. A valid fields query would be : FirstName,LastName. A valid fields query for Nested fields will be roles.RoleGUIDLOV.RoleName,FirstName,LastName

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the order of the result set. A valid order by query would be: FirstName desc. For example : FirstName desc,DisplayName asc

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Employee JSON Object

AddressLine1.description: First line of the primary mailing address.
AddressLine1.title: Address Line 1

AddressLine2.description: Second line of the primary mailing address.
AddressLine2.title: Address Line 2

AddressLine3.description: Third line of the primary mailing address.
AddressLine3.title: Address Line 3

CitizenshipId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

CitizenshipLegislationCode.description: Legislation code derived from the legal entity. Valid values are defined in the list CitizenshipLegislationCodeLOV.
CitizenshipLegislationCode.title: Citizenship

CitizenshipStatus.description: Status of the person's citizenship. Valid values are defined in the list CitizenshipStatusLOV.
CitizenshipStatus.title: Citizenship Status

City.description: Town or city in which the address is located.
City.title: Town or City

CorrespondenceLanguage.description: Preferred language for communication. Valid values are defined in the list CorrespondenceLanguageLOV.
CorrespondenceLanguage.title: Correspondence Language

Country.description: Country in which the address is located.
Country.title: Country

CreationDate.description: Date and time of creation of the employee record.

DateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the person.
DateOfBirth.title: Date of Birth

DriversLicenseExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the driver's license.
DriversLicenseExpirationDate.title: To Date

DriversLicenseIssuingCountry.description: Country that issued the driver's license.
DriversLicenseIssuingCountry.title: Issuing Country

EffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee is effective.
EffectiveStartDate.title: Effective Start Date

Ethnicity.description: Person's ethnicity for the legislation code. Valid values are defined in the list EthnicityLOV.
Ethnicity.title: Ethnicity

Gender.description: Person's gender. Valid values are defined in the list GenderLOV.
Gender.title: Gender

HomeFaxLegislationCode.title: Country Code

HomePhoneExtension.title: Extension

HomePhoneLegislationCode.title: Country Code

Honors.description: Higher qualification appended to a person's name. For example, PhD.
Honors.title: Honors

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time of update of the employee record.

LegalEntityId.description: Unique identifier for the legal entity. Valid values are defined in the list LegalEmployerLOV.

MaritalStatus.description: Person's marital status. Valid values are defined in the list MaritalStatusLOV.
MaritalStatus.title: Marital Status

MilitaryVetStatus.description: Indicates whether the person is on military service. Valid values are defined in the listt MilitaryVetStatusLOV.

NameSuffix.description: Part of the name appended to a person's last name such as Jr., III, etc.

NationalId.description: Primary key generated by the application.
NationalId.title: National ID

NationalIdExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the national identifier.
NationalIdExpirationDate.title: Expiration Date

NationalIdType.description: Type of national identifier. Valid values are defined in the list NationalIdTypeLOV.
NationalIdType.title: National ID Type

PassportId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

PersonNumber.description: Number assigned to a person to identify the person uniquely. Does not depend on the person type (employee, contingent worker, etc). Search on this attribute is not case sensitive.
PersonNumber.title: Person Number

PreviousLastName.description: Previous last name of the person, if any.
PreviousLastName.title: Previous Last Name

ProjectedTerminationDate.description: Projected termination date for the worker.

Region.description: Primary region in which the address is located.
Region.title: Region 1

Region2.description: Secondary region within the primary region.
Region2.title: Region 2

Religion.description: Person's religion. Valid values are defined in the list ReligionLOV.
Religion.title: Religion

ReligionId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

Salutation.description: Person salutation such as Mr., Ms., and so on. Valid values are defined in the list SalutationLOV.
Salutation.title: Title

UserName.description: User name for the record. This value is optional and is automatically generated if not specified. Also works with UsernameMatching attribute. Search on this attribute is not case sensitive.

WorkEmail.description: Person's work email address. Search on this attribute is not case sensitive.
WorkEmail.title: Email

WorkerType.description: Primary type of a worker such as employee (E), contingent worker (C), pending worker (P), or non-worker (N). This is a read-only attribute as indicated in the describe metadata.

assignments.description:
The assignments resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignments as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignments.title: Assignments

directReports.description:
The directReports resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee direct reports as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
directReports.title: Direct Reports

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

personDFF.description:
The personDFF resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee descriptive flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
personDFF.title: Person Descriptive Flexfields

personExtraInformation.description:
The personExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional person information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
personExtraInformation.title: Person Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

photo.description:
The photo resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee primary photos as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
photo.title: Photos

roles.description:
The roles resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee roles as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
roles.title: Roles

visas.description:
The visas resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee visas as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
visas.title: Visas

x-links.description:
The list of values for person salutation.

The following properties are defined on the LOV link relation:

  • Source Attribute: Salutation; Target Attribute: LookupCode
  • Display Attribute: LookupCode
  • Display Attribute: Meaning

dependency.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

links.description: The link relations associated with the resource instance.

offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

Meaning.description: Display value for the lookup in the application.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Extensible flexfield for assignment.

ObjectVersionNumber.description: Used to implement optimistic locking. This number is incremented every time a row is updated. The number is compared at the start and end of a transaction to detect whether another session has updated the row from the time it was queried.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

AsgResponsibilityId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

ResponsibilityName.description: Name of an area of responsibility.

ResponsibilityTypeCode.description: Identifier of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. The value is validated against HCM_LOOKUPS with the lookup type PER_RESPONSIBILITY_TYPES.

ResponsibilityTypeName.description: Name of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. For example, Benefits Representative.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

ActionCode.description: Action performed on a particular record, such as Hire, Add Pending Worker, Manager Change, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list ActionCodeLOV.
ActionCode.title: Action Code

ActionReasonCode.description: User-defined code for the action reason. Specifies the reason for the action performed on the record. Valid values are defined in the list ActionReasonCodeLOV.
ActionReasonCode.title: Reason Code

ActualTerminationDate.description: Actual date of termination of employment. This is required during termination, when the TerminateWorkRelationshipFlag is set to Y.

AssignmentCategory.description: User-defined category such as Full-Time Permanent or Part-Time Permanent. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentCategoryLOV.
AssignmentCategory.title: Assignment Category

AssignmentId.description: Unique identifier for the assignment. This is a primary key generated by the application.
AssignmentId.title: Assignment ID

AssignmentNumber.description: Unique identifier for the assignment or terms. Valid for workers and nonworkers.
AssignmentNumber.title: Assignment Number

AssignmentProjectedEndDate.description: Date on which the assignment is expected to end.
AssignmentProjectedEndDate.title: Projected End Date

AssignmentStatus.description: HR status of the assignment, such as Active or Inactive. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusLOV.
AssignmentStatus.title: Assignment Status

AssignmentStatusTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the user-defined assignment status. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusTypeIdLOV.

BusinessUnitId.description: Unique identifier for the business unit. Valid values are defined in the list BusinessUnitIdLOV.

CreationDate.description: Date and time of creation of the employee assignment record.

DefaultExpenseAccount.description: Default expense account represented as a concatenated value of all the related segments.

DepartmentId.description: Unique identifier for the department. Valid values are defined in the list DepartmentIdLOV.

EffectiveEndDate.description: Date at the end of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

Frequency.description: Frequency of normal working hours such as week, month, year. Valid values are defined in the list FrequencyLOV.
Frequency.title: Frequency

FullPartTime.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is full-time or part-time. Valid values are defined in the list FullPartTimeLOV.
FullPartTime.title: Full Time or Part Time

GradeId.description: Unique identifier for the grade. Valid values are defined in the list GradeIdLOV.

GradeLadderId.description: Unique identifier for the grade ladder.

JobId.description: Unique identifier for the job. Valid values are defined in the list JobIdLOV.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time of update of the employee assignment record.

LegalEntityId.description: Unique identifier for the legal entity.

LocationId.description: Unique identifier for the location. Valid values are defined in the list LocationIdLOV.

ManagerId.description: Unique identifier for a manager. Valid values are defined in the list ManagerIdLOV.
ManagerId.title: Manager ID

ManagerType.description: Role of the manager with regards to the overall organization structure. For example, functional, project leader, and so on.
ManagerType.title: Type

OriginalHireDate.description: Original date of hire for employment.

PeopleGroup.description: People group represented as a concatenated value of all the related key flexfield segments.

PeriodOfServiceId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

PersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the person type. Valid values are defined in the list PersonTypeIdLOV.

PositionId.description: Unique identifier for a position. Valid values are defined in the list PositionIdLOV.

PrimaryAssignmentFlag.description: Indicates whether the current assignment is the primary assignment. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryAssignmentFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.description: Indicates whether the current work relationship is primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.description: Indicates whether the current employment terms are primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.title: Primary employment terms

ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.description: Units for the probation period duration. Valid values are defined in the list QUALIFYING_UNITS.
ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.title: Probation Unit

ProjectedStartDate.description: Proposed start date for the pending worker.
ProjectedStartDate.title: Projected Start Date

ProposedPersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the worker class. This value is valid only if the PersonTypeId is Pending Worker. It can be any of the employee or contingent worker types. Valid values are defined in the list ProposedPersonTypeIdLOV.
ProposedPersonTypeId.title: Proposed Person Type

RegularTemporary.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is regular or temporary. Valid values are defined in the list RegularTemporaryLOV.
RegularTemporary.title: Regular or Temporary

SalaryAmount.description: Salary amount entered based on the salary frequency.
SalaryAmount.title: Salary Amount

SalaryBasisId.description: Identifier for the set of details linked to a worker's base pay. It identifies the payroll characteristics used to pay base earnings, the duration for which base pay is quoted, the factor used to annualize base pay, any components used to attribute base pay adjustments to different reasons, and any associated grade rate for salary validation. Valid values are defined in the list  SalaryBasisIdLOV.

SalaryCode.description: Identifies whether the assignment is paid by the hour or by a salary. Either maintained at the assignment level or employment or placement terms but not both. Valid values are defined in the list SalaryCodeLOV.
SalaryCode.title: Hourly Paid or Salaried

TermsEffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee term is effective.

WorkTaxAddressId.description: Unique identifier for the address that is used for taxation purposes. This can be different from a mailing address. Valid values are defined in the list WorkTaxAddressIdLOV.

WorkerCategory.description: Category of the worker such as Blue Collar, Civil Servant, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list WorkerCategoryLOV.
WorkerCategory.title: Worker Category

WorkingAsManager.description: Indicates whether the person is a manager. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAsManager.title: Working as a Manager

WorkingAtHome.description: Indicates whether the person is working at home. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAtHome.title: Working at Home

assignmentDFF.description:
The assignmentDFF resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentDFF.title: Assignment Descriptive Flexfields

assignmentExtraInformation.description:
The assignmentExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional assignment information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentExtraInformation.title: Assignment Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

empreps.description:
The empreps resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee representatives as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
empreps.title: Employee Representatives

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.description:
The peopleGroupKeyFlexfield resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.title: People Group Key Flexfields

assignments.description:
The assignments resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignments as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignments.title: Assignments

directReports.description:
The directReports resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee direct reports as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
directReports.title: Direct Reports

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

personDFF.description:
The personDFF resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee descriptive flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
personDFF.title: Person Descriptive Flexfields

personExtraInformation.description:
The personExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional person information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
personExtraInformation.title: Person Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

photo.description:
The photo resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee primary photos as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
photo.title: Photos

roles.description:
The roles resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee roles as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
roles.title: Roles

visas.description:
The visas resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee visas as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
visas.title: Visas

x-links.description:
The list of values for person salutation.

The following properties are defined on the LOV link relation:

  • Source Attribute: Salutation; Target Attribute: LookupCode
  • Display Attribute: LookupCode

dependency.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

links.description: The link relations associated with the resource instance.

offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

Meaning.description: Display value for the lookup in the application.

ResponsibilityName.description: Name of an area of responsibility.

ActionCode.description: Action performed on a particular record, such as Hire, Add Pending Worker, Manager Change, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list ActionCodeLOV.
ActionCode.title: Action Code

ActionReasonCode.description: User-defined code for the action reason. Specifies the reason for the action performed on the record. Valid values are defined in the list ActionReasonCodeLOV.
ActionReasonCode.title: Reason Code

ActualTerminationDate.description: Actual date of termination of employment. This is required during termination, when the TerminateWorkRelationshipFlag is set to Y.

AssignmentCategory.description: User-defined category such as Full-Time Permanent or Part-Time Permanent. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentCategoryLOV.
AssignmentCategory.title: Assignment Category

AssignmentId.title: Assignment ID

AssignmentNumber.description: Unique identifier for the assignment or terms. Valid for workers and nonworkers.
AssignmentNumber.title: Assignment Number

AssignmentProjectedEndDate.description: Date on which the assignment is expected to end.
AssignmentProjectedEndDate.title: Projected End Date

AssignmentStatus.description: HR status of the assignment, such as Active or Inactive. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusLOV.
AssignmentStatus.title: Assignment Status

AssignmentStatusTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the user-defined assignment status. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusTypeIdLOV.

BusinessUnitId.description: Unique identifier for the business unit. Valid values are defined in the list BusinessUnitIdLOV.

CreationDate.description: Date and time of creation of the employee assignment record.

DefaultExpenseAccount.description: Default expense account represented as a concatenated value of all the related segments.

DepartmentId.description: Unique identifier for the department. Valid values are defined in the list DepartmentIdLOV.

EffectiveEndDate.description: Date at the end of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

Frequency.description: Frequency of normal working hours such as week, month, year. Valid values are defined in the list FrequencyLOV.
Frequency.title: Frequency

FullPartTime.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is full-time or part-time. Valid values are defined in the list FullPartTimeLOV.
FullPartTime.title: Full Time or Part Time

GradeId.description: Unique identifier for the grade. Valid values are defined in the list GradeIdLOV.

GradeLadderId.description: Unique identifier for the grade ladder.

JobId.description: Unique identifier for the job. Valid values are defined in the list JobIdLOV.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time of update of the employee assignment record.

LegalEntityId.description: Unique identifier for the legal entity.

LocationId.description: Unique identifier for the location. Valid values are defined in the list LocationIdLOV.

ManagerId.description: Unique identifier for a manager. Valid values are defined in the list ManagerIdLOV.
ManagerId.title: Manager ID

ManagerType.description: Role of the manager with regards to the overall organization structure. For example, functional, project leader, and so on.
ManagerType.title: Type

OriginalHireDate.description: Original date of hire for employment.

PeopleGroup.description: People group represented as a concatenated value of all the related key flexfield segments.

PeriodOfServiceId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

PersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the person type. Valid values are defined in the list PersonTypeIdLOV.

PositionId.description: Unique identifier for a position. Valid values are defined in the list PositionIdLOV.

PrimaryAssignmentFlag.description: Indicates whether the current assignment is the primary assignment. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryAssignmentFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.description: Indicates whether the current work relationship is primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.description: Indicates whether the current employment terms are primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.title: Primary employment terms

ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.description: Units for the probation period duration. Valid values are defined in the list QUALIFYING_UNITS.
ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.title: Probation Unit

ProjectedStartDate.description: Proposed start date for the pending worker.
ProjectedStartDate.title: Projected Start Date

ProposedPersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the worker class. This value is valid only if the PersonTypeId is Pending Worker. It can be any of the employee or contingent worker types. Valid values are defined in the list ProposedPersonTypeIdLOV.
ProposedPersonTypeId.title: Proposed Person Type

RegularTemporary.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is regular or temporary. Valid values are defined in the list RegularTemporaryLOV.
RegularTemporary.title: Regular or Temporary

SalaryAmount.description: Salary amount entered based on the salary frequency.
SalaryAmount.title: Salary Amount

SalaryBasisId.description: Identifier for the set of details linked to a worker's base pay. It identifies the payroll characteristics used to pay base earnings, the duration for which base pay is quoted, the factor used to annualize base pay, any components used to attribute base pay adjustments to different reasons, and any associated grade rate for salary validation. Valid values are defined in the list  SalaryBasisIdLOV.

SalaryCode.description: Identifies whether the assignment is paid by the hour or by a salary. Either maintained at the assignment level or employment or placement terms but not both. Valid values are defined in the list SalaryCodeLOV.
SalaryCode.title: Hourly Paid or Salaried

TermsEffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee term is effective.

WorkTaxAddressId.description: Unique identifier for the address that is used for taxation purposes. This can be different from a mailing address. Valid values are defined in the list WorkTaxAddressIdLOV.

WorkerCategory.description: Category of the worker such as Blue Collar, Civil Servant, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list WorkerCategoryLOV.
WorkerCategory.title: Worker Category

WorkingAsManager.description: Indicates whether the person is a manager. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAsManager.title: Working as a Manager

WorkingAtHome.description: Indicates whether the person is working at home. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAtHome.title: Working at Home

assignmentDFF.description:
The assignmentDFF resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentDFF.title: Assignment Descriptive Flexfields

assignmentExtraInformation.description:
The assignmentExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional assignment information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentExtraInformation.title: Assignment Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

empreps.description:
The empreps resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee representatives as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
empreps.title: Employee Representatives

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.description:
The peopleGroupKeyFlexfield resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.title: People Group Key Flexfields

dependency.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

links.description: The link relations associated with the resource instance.

offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

SystemPersonType.description: Worker class. This is defined either at the assignment level or in the employment terms, and defaults from the person-organization relationship. For example, Contingent worker, Employee.

UserPersonType.description: Worker class. This is defined either at the assignment level or in the employment terms, and defaults from the person-organization relationship. For example, Assignee, Consultant, Expatriate, Agency/Temp, Intern, Apprentice, Contractor, Trainee.

WorkerType.description: Primary type of a worker such as employee (E), contingent worker (C), pending worker (P), or non-worker (N). This is a read-only attribute as indicated in the describe metadata.

assignments.description:
The assignments resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignments as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignments.title: Assignments

directReports.description:
The directReports resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee direct reports as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
directReports.title: Direct Reports

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

personDFF.description:
The personDFF resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee descriptive flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
personDFF.title: Person Descriptive Flexfields

personExtraInformation.description:
The personExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional person information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
personExtraInformation.title: Person Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

photo.description:
The photo resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee primary photos as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
photo.title: Photos

roles.description:
The roles resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee roles as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
roles.title: Roles

visas.description:
The visas resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee visas as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
visas.title: Visas

dependency.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

links.description: The link relations associated with the resource instance.

offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

Meaning.description: Display value for the lookup in the application.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Extensible flexfield for assignment.

ObjectVersionNumber.description: Used to implement optimistic locking. This number is incremented every time a row is updated. The number is compared at the start and end of a transaction to detect whether another session has updated the row from the time it was queried.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

AsgResponsibilityId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

ResponsibilityName.description: Name of an area of responsibility.

ResponsibilityTypeCode.description: Identifier of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. The value is validated against HCM_LOOKUPS with the lookup type PER_RESPONSIBILITY_TYPES.

ResponsibilityTypeName.description: Name of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. For example, Benefits Representative.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

ActionCode.description: Action performed on a particular record, such as Hire, Add Pending Worker, Manager Change, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list ActionCodeLOV.
ActionCode.title: Action Code

ActionReasonCode.description: User-defined code for the action reason. Specifies the reason for the action performed on the record. Valid values are defined in the list ActionReasonCodeLOV.
ActionReasonCode.title: Reason Code

ActualTerminationDate.description: Actual date of termination of employment. This is required during termination, when the TerminateWorkRelationshipFlag is set to Y.

AssignmentCategory.description: User-defined category such as Full-Time Permanent or Part-Time Permanent. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentCategoryLOV.
AssignmentCategory.title: Assignment Category

AssignmentId.description: Unique identifier for the assignment. This is a primary key generated by the application.
AssignmentId.title: Assignment ID

AssignmentNumber.description: Unique identifier for the assignment or terms. Valid for workers and nonworkers.
AssignmentNumber.title: Assignment Number

AssignmentProjectedEndDate.description: Date on which the assignment is expected to end.
AssignmentProjectedEndDate.title: Projected End Date

AssignmentStatus.description: HR status of the assignment, such as Active or Inactive. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusLOV.
AssignmentStatus.title: Assignment Status

AssignmentStatusTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the user-defined assignment status. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusTypeIdLOV.

BusinessUnitId.description: Unique identifier for the business unit. Valid values are defined in the list BusinessUnitIdLOV.

CreationDate.description: Date and time of creation of the employee assignment record.

DefaultExpenseAccount.description: Default expense account represented as a concatenated value of all the related segments.

DepartmentId.description: Unique identifier for the department. Valid values are defined in the list DepartmentIdLOV.

EffectiveEndDate.description: Date at the end of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

Frequency.description: Frequency of normal working hours such as week, month, year. Valid values are defined in the list FrequencyLOV.
Frequency.title: Frequency

FullPartTime.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is full-time or part-time. Valid values are defined in the list FullPartTimeLOV.
FullPartTime.title: Full Time or Part Time

GradeId.description: Unique identifier for the grade. Valid values are defined in the list GradeIdLOV.

GradeLadderId.description: Unique identifier for the grade ladder.

JobId.description: Unique identifier for the job. Valid values are defined in the list JobIdLOV.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time of update of the employee assignment record.

LegalEntityId.description: Unique identifier for the legal entity.

LocationId.description: Unique identifier for the location. Valid values are defined in the list LocationIdLOV.

ManagerId.description: Unique identifier for a manager. Valid values are defined in the list ManagerIdLOV.
ManagerId.title: Manager ID

ManagerType.description: Role of the manager with regards to the overall organization structure. For example, functional, project leader, and so on.
ManagerType.title: Type

OriginalHireDate.description: Original date of hire for employment.

PeopleGroup.description: People group represented as a concatenated value of all the related key flexfield segments.

PeriodOfServiceId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

PersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the person type. Valid values are defined in the list PersonTypeIdLOV.

PositionId.description: Unique identifier for a position. Valid values are defined in the list PositionIdLOV.

PrimaryAssignmentFlag.description: Indicates whether the current assignment is the primary assignment. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryAssignmentFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.description: Indicates whether the current work relationship is primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.description: Indicates whether the current employment terms are primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.title: Primary employment terms

ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.description: Units for the probation period duration. Valid values are defined in the list QUALIFYING_UNITS.
ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.title: Probation Unit

ProjectedStartDate.description: Proposed start date for the pending worker.
ProjectedStartDate.title: Projected Start Date

ProposedPersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the worker class. This value is valid only if the PersonTypeId is Pending Worker. It can be any of the employee or contingent worker types. Valid values are defined in the list ProposedPersonTypeIdLOV.
ProposedPersonTypeId.title: Proposed Person Type

RegularTemporary.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is regular or temporary. Valid values are defined in the list RegularTemporaryLOV.
RegularTemporary.title: Regular or Temporary

SalaryAmount.description: Salary amount entered based on the salary frequency.
SalaryAmount.title: Salary Amount

SalaryBasisId.description: Identifier for the set of details linked to a worker's base pay. It identifies the payroll characteristics used to pay base earnings, the duration for which base pay is quoted, the factor used to annualize base pay, any components used to attribute base pay adjustments to different reasons, and any associated grade rate for salary validation. Valid values are defined in the list  SalaryBasisIdLOV.

SalaryCode.description: Identifies whether the assignment is paid by the hour or by a salary. Either maintained at the assignment level or employment or placement terms but not both. Valid values are defined in the list SalaryCodeLOV.
SalaryCode.title: Hourly Paid or Salaried

TermsEffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee term is effective.

WorkTaxAddressId.description: Unique identifier for the address that is used for taxation purposes. This can be different from a mailing address. Valid values are defined in the list WorkTaxAddressIdLOV.

WorkerCategory.description: Category of the worker such as Blue Collar, Civil Servant, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list WorkerCategoryLOV.
WorkerCategory.title: Worker Category

WorkingAsManager.description: Indicates whether the person is a manager. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAsManager.title: Working as a Manager

WorkingAtHome.description: Indicates whether the person is working at home. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAtHome.title: Working at Home

assignmentDFF.description:
The assignmentDFF resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentDFF.title: Assignment Descriptive Flexfields

assignmentExtraInformation.description:
The assignmentExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional assignment information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentExtraInformation.title: Assignment Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

empreps.description:
The empreps resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee representatives as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
empreps.title: Employee Representatives

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.description:
The peopleGroupKeyFlexfield resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.title: People Group Key Flexfields

x-links.description:
The list of values for the worker class, such as CONSULTANT, TRAINEE.

The following properties are defined on the LOV link relation:

  • Source Attribute: PersonTypeId; Target Attribute: PersonTypeId
  • Display Attribute: PersonTypeId
  • Display Attribute: SystemPersonType
  • Display Attribute: UserPersonType

dependency.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

links.description: The link relations associated with the resource instance.

offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

SystemPersonType.description: Worker class. This is defined either at the assignment level or in the employment terms, and defaults from the person-organization relationship. For example, Contingent worker, Employee.

UserPersonType.description: Worker class. This is defined either at the assignment level or in the employment terms, and defaults from the person-organization relationship. For example, Assignee, Consultant, Expatriate, Agency/Temp, Intern, Apprentice, Contractor, Trainee.

SalaryBasisId.description: Identifier for the set of details linked to a worker's base pay. It identifies the payroll characteristics used to pay base earnings, the duration for which base pay is quoted, the factor used to annualize base pay, any components used to attribute base pay adjustments to different reasons, and any associated grade rate for salary validation.

The assignments resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignments as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Extensible flexfield for assignment.

ObjectVersionNumber.description: Used to implement optimistic locking. This number is incremented every time a row is updated. The number is compared at the start and end of a transaction to detect whether another session has updated the row from the time it was queried.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

AsgResponsibilityId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

ResponsibilityName.description: Name of an area of responsibility.

ResponsibilityTypeCode.description: Identifier of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. The value is validated against HCM_LOOKUPS with the lookup type PER_RESPONSIBILITY_TYPES.

ResponsibilityTypeName.description: Name of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. For example, Benefits Representative.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

ActionCode.description: Action performed on a particular record, such as Hire, Add Pending Worker, Manager Change, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list ActionCodeLOV.
ActionCode.title: Action Code

ActionReasonCode.description: User-defined code for the action reason. Specifies the reason for the action performed on the record. Valid values are defined in the list ActionReasonCodeLOV.
ActionReasonCode.title: Reason Code

ActualTerminationDate.description: Actual date of termination of employment. This is required during termination, when the TerminateWorkRelationshipFlag is set to Y.

AssignmentCategory.description: User-defined category such as Full-Time Permanent or Part-Time Permanent. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentCategoryLOV.
AssignmentCategory.title: Assignment Category

AssignmentId.description: Unique identifier for the assignment. This is a primary key generated by the application.
AssignmentId.title: Assignment ID

AssignmentNumber.description: Unique identifier for the assignment or terms. Valid for workers and nonworkers.
AssignmentNumber.title: Assignment Number

AssignmentProjectedEndDate.description: Date on which the assignment is expected to end.
AssignmentProjectedEndDate.title: Projected End Date

AssignmentStatus.description: HR status of the assignment, such as Active or Inactive. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusLOV.
AssignmentStatus.title: Assignment Status

AssignmentStatusTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the user-defined assignment status. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusTypeIdLOV.

BusinessUnitId.description: Unique identifier for the business unit. Valid values are defined in the list BusinessUnitIdLOV.

CreationDate.description: Date and time of creation of the employee assignment record.

DefaultExpenseAccount.description: Default expense account represented as a concatenated value of all the related segments.

DepartmentId.description: Unique identifier for the department. Valid values are defined in the list DepartmentIdLOV.

EffectiveEndDate.description: Date at the end of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

Frequency.description: Frequency of normal working hours such as week, month, year. Valid values are defined in the list FrequencyLOV.
Frequency.title: Frequency

FullPartTime.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is full-time or part-time. Valid values are defined in the list FullPartTimeLOV.
FullPartTime.title: Full Time or Part Time

GradeId.description: Unique identifier for the grade. Valid values are defined in the list GradeIdLOV.

GradeLadderId.description: Unique identifier for the grade ladder.

JobId.description: Unique identifier for the job. Valid values are defined in the list JobIdLOV.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time of update of the employee assignment record.

LegalEntityId.description: Unique identifier for the legal entity.

LocationId.description: Unique identifier for the location. Valid values are defined in the list LocationIdLOV.

ManagerId.description: Unique identifier for a manager. Valid values are defined in the list ManagerIdLOV.
ManagerId.title: Manager ID

ManagerType.description: Role of the manager with regards to the overall organization structure. For example, functional, project leader, and so on.
ManagerType.title: Type

OriginalHireDate.description: Original date of hire for employment.

PeopleGroup.description: People group represented as a concatenated value of all the related key flexfield segments.

PeriodOfServiceId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

PersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the person type. Valid values are defined in the list PersonTypeIdLOV.

PositionId.description: Unique identifier for a position. Valid values are defined in the list PositionIdLOV.

PrimaryAssignmentFlag.description: Indicates whether the current assignment is the primary assignment. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryAssignmentFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.description: Indicates whether the current work relationship is primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.description: Indicates whether the current employment terms are primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.title: Primary employment terms

ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.description: Units for the probation period duration. Valid values are defined in the list QUALIFYING_UNITS.
ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.title: Probation Unit

ProjectedStartDate.description: Proposed start date for the pending worker.
ProjectedStartDate.title: Projected Start Date

ProposedPersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the worker class. This value is valid only if the PersonTypeId is Pending Worker. It can be any of the employee or contingent worker types. Valid values are defined in the list ProposedPersonTypeIdLOV.
ProposedPersonTypeId.title: Proposed Person Type

RegularTemporary.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is regular or temporary. Valid values are defined in the list RegularTemporaryLOV.
RegularTemporary.title: Regular or Temporary

SalaryAmount.description: Salary amount entered based on the salary frequency.
SalaryAmount.title: Salary Amount

SalaryBasisId.description: Identifier for the set of details linked to a worker's base pay. It identifies the payroll characteristics used to pay base earnings, the duration for which base pay is quoted, the factor used to annualize base pay, any components used to attribute base pay adjustments to different reasons, and any associated grade rate for salary validation. Valid values are defined in the list  SalaryBasisIdLOV.

SalaryCode.description: Identifies whether the assignment is paid by the hour or by a salary. Either maintained at the assignment level or employment or placement terms but not both. Valid values are defined in the list SalaryCodeLOV.
SalaryCode.title: Hourly Paid or Salaried

TermsEffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee term is effective.

WorkTaxAddressId.description: Unique identifier for the address that is used for taxation purposes. This can be different from a mailing address. Valid values are defined in the list WorkTaxAddressIdLOV.

WorkerCategory.description: Category of the worker such as Blue Collar, Civil Servant, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list WorkerCategoryLOV.
WorkerCategory.title: Worker Category

WorkingAsManager.description: Indicates whether the person is a manager. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAsManager.title: Working as a Manager

WorkingAtHome.description: Indicates whether the person is working at home. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAtHome.title: Working at Home

assignmentDFF.description:
The assignmentDFF resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentDFF.title: Assignment Descriptive Flexfields

assignmentExtraInformation.description:
The assignmentExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional assignment information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentExtraInformation.title: Assignment Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

empreps.description:
The empreps resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee representatives as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
empreps.title: Employee Representatives

This resource is currently under controlled availability.
peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.title: People Group Key Flexfields

offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

PersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for a person type.

SystemPersonType.description: Worker class. This is defined either at the assignment level or in the employment terms, and defaults from the person-organization relationship. For example, Contingent Worker, Employee.

UserPersonType.description: Worker class. This is defined either at the assignment level or in the employment terms, and defaults from the person-organization relationship. For example, Assignee, Consultant, Expatriate, Agency/Temp, Intern, Apprentice, Contractor, Trainee.

This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

links.description: The link relations associated with the resource instance.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. EffectiveStartDate.description: Extensible flexfield for assignment.

ObjectVersionNumber.description: Used to implement optimistic locking. This number is incremented every time a row is updated. The number is compared at the start and end of a transaction to detect whether another session has updated the row from the time it was queried.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

AsgResponsibilityId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

ResponsibilityName.description: Name of an area of responsibility.

ResponsibilityTypeCode.description: Identifier of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. The value is validated against HCM_LOOKUPS with the lookup type PER_RESPONSIBILITY_TYPES.

ResponsibilityTypeName.description: Name of the responsibility type for which this record holds the criteria. For example, Benefits Representative.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

ActionCode.description: Action performed on a particular record, such as Hire, Add Pending Worker, Manager Change, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list ActionCodeLOV.
ActionCode.title: Action Code

ActionReasonCode.description: User-defined code for the action reason. Specifies the reason for the action performed on the record. Valid values are defined in the list ActionReasonCodeLOV.
ActionReasonCode.title: Reason Code

ActualTerminationDate.description: Actual date of termination of employment. This is required during termination, when the TerminateWorkRelationshipFlag is set to Y.

AssignmentCategory.description: User-defined category such as Full-Time Permanent or Part-Time Permanent. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentCategoryLOV.
AssignmentCategory.title: Assignment Category

AssignmentId.description: Unique identifier for the assignment. This is a primary key generated by the application.
AssignmentId.title: Assignment ID

AssignmentNumber.description: Unique identifier for the assignment or terms. Valid for workers and nonworkers.
AssignmentNumber.title: Assignment Number

AssignmentProjectedEndDate.description: Date on which the assignment is expected to end.
AssignmentProjectedEndDate.title: Projected End Date

AssignmentStatus.description: HR status of the assignment, such as Active or Inactive. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusLOV.
AssignmentStatus.title: Assignment Status

AssignmentStatusTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the user-defined assignment status. Valid values are defined in the list AssignmentStatusTypeIdLOV.

BusinessUnitId.description: Unique identifier for the business unit. Valid values are defined in the list BusinessUnitIdLOV.

CreationDate.description: Date and time of creation of the employee assignment record.

DefaultExpenseAccount.description: Default expense account represented as a concatenated value of all the related segments.

DepartmentId.description: Unique identifier for the department. Valid values are defined in the list DepartmentIdLOV.

EffectiveEndDate.description: Date at the end of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee assignment is effective.

Frequency.description: Frequency of normal working hours such as week, month, year. Valid values are defined in the list FrequencyLOV.
Frequency.title: Frequency

FullPartTime.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is full-time or part-time. Valid values are defined in the list FullPartTimeLOV.
FullPartTime.title: Full Time or Part Time

GradeId.description: Unique identifier for the grade. Valid values are defined in the list GradeIdLOV.

GradeLadderId.description: Unique identifier for the grade ladder.

JobId.description: Unique identifier for the job. Valid values are defined in the list JobIdLOV.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time of update of the employee assignment record.

LegalEntityId.description: Unique identifier for the legal entity.

LocationId.description: Unique identifier for the location. Valid values are defined in the list LocationIdLOV.

ManagerId.description: Unique identifier for a manager. Valid values are defined in the list ManagerIdLOV.
ManagerId.title: Manager ID

ManagerType.description: Role of the manager with regards to the overall organization structure. For example, functional, project leader, and so on.
ManagerType.title: Type

OriginalHireDate.description: Original date of hire for employment.

PeopleGroup.description: People group represented as a concatenated value of all the related key flexfield segments.

PeriodOfServiceId.description: Primary key generated by the application.

PersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the person type. Valid values are defined in the list PersonTypeIdLOV.

PositionId.description: Unique identifier for a position. Valid values are defined in the list PositionIdLOV.

PrimaryAssignmentFlag.description: Indicates whether the current assignment is the primary assignment. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryAssignmentFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.description: Indicates whether the current work relationship is primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkRelationFlag.title: Primary

PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.description: Indicates whether the current employment terms are primary. Valid values are Yes and No.
PrimaryWorkTermsFlag.title: Primary employment terms

ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.description: Units for the probation period duration. Valid values are defined in the list QUALIFYING_UNITS.
ProbationPeriodUnitOfMeasure.title: Probation Unit

ProjectedStartDate.description: Proposed start date for the pending worker.
ProjectedStartDate.title: Projected Start Date

ProposedPersonTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the worker class. This value is valid only if the PersonTypeId is Pending Worker. It can be any of the employee or contingent worker types. Valid values are defined in the list ProposedPersonTypeIdLOV.
ProposedPersonTypeId.title: Proposed Person Type

RegularTemporary.description: Indicates whether the position the employee is hired for is regular or temporary. Valid values are defined in the list RegularTemporaryLOV.
RegularTemporary.title: Regular or Temporary

SalaryAmount.description: Salary amount entered based on the salary frequency.
SalaryAmount.title: Salary Amount

SalaryBasisId.description: Identifier for the set of details linked to a worker's base pay. It identifies the payroll characteristics used to pay base earnings, the duration for which base pay is quoted, the factor used to annualize base pay, any components used to attribute base pay adjustments to different reasons, and any associated grade rate for salary validation. Valid values are defined in the list  SalaryBasisIdLOV.

SalaryCode.description: Identifies whether the assignment is paid by the hour or by a salary. Either maintained at the assignment level or employment or placement terms but not both. Valid values are defined in the list SalaryCodeLOV.
SalaryCode.title: Hourly Paid or Salaried

TermsEffectiveStartDate.description: Date at the beginning of the date range within which the employee term is effective.

WorkTaxAddressId.description: Unique identifier for the address that is used for taxation purposes. This can be different from a mailing address. Valid values are defined in the list WorkTaxAddressIdLOV.

WorkerCategory.description: Category of the worker such as Blue Collar, Civil Servant, and so on. Valid values are defined in the list WorkerCategoryLOV.
WorkerCategory.title: Worker Category

WorkingAsManager.description: Indicates whether the person is a manager. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAsManager.title: Working as a Manager

WorkingAtHome.description: Indicates whether the person is working at home. Valid values are Yes and No.
WorkingAtHome.title: Working at Home

assignmentDFF.description:
The assignmentDFF resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentDFF.title: Assignment Descriptive Flexfields

assignmentExtraInformation.description:
The assignmentExtraInformation resource is a child of the emps resource. It includes all the extensible flexfields for additional assignment information as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
assignmentExtraInformation.title: Assignment Extra Information Extensible FlexFields

empreps.description:
The empreps resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee representatives as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
empreps.title: Employee Representatives

peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.description:
The peopleGroupKeyFlexfield resource is a child of the assignments resource, and hence a child of child of the emps resource. It includes all employee assignment key flexfields as of the specified date. By default, the current date is retained.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
peopleGroupKeyFlexfield.title: People Group Key Flexfields

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Time Card Id

assignmentNumber.description: Assignment number of the person associated with the time record.

comment.description: Comment associated with the time record.

earnedDate.description: Time entry date determined by the earned day rule configuration.

groupType.description: Layer where time records are retrieved from, such as processed time or absence entry details.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

measure.description: Quantity of the time record, either hours or units.

overtimeDate.description: Time entry date determined by the overtime day rule and start time configuration.

personId.description: Unique identifier for the person associated with the time record.

personNumber.description: Number of the person associated with the time record.

recordType.description: Type of the time record, either measure or range.

timeAttributes.description:
The timeAttributes resource is a child of the time records resource. It is a qualifier associated with the time record that reflects how time is paid, costed, billed, or recorded as an information entry. For example, the payroll time type attribute indicates if the time for payroll consumers must be paid.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
timeAttributes.title: Time Attributes

timeMessages.description:
The timeMessages resource is a child of the time records resource. It is a unique identifier for the message associated with the time record. A message gives some information on the time record resulting from rules or validations.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
timeMessages.title: Time Messages

timeRecordGroupId.description: Unique identifier for the time record group.

timeRecordGroupVersion.description: Version number of the time record group stored in the Workforce Management time repository.

timeRecordId.description: Unique identifier for the time record.

timeRecordVersion.description: Version number of the time record stored in the Workforce Management time repository.

timeStatuses.description:
The timeStatuses resource is a child of the time records resource. It is a unique identifier for the status of the time record sent using the time records REST API.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
timeStatuses.title: Time Statuses

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the time record such as hours or units.

attributeId.description: Unique identifier for the time record attribute.

attributeName.description: Name of the attribute of the time record, such as Payroll Time Type.

attributeType.description: Type of the attribute of the time record, such as Varchar.

attributeValue.description: Value of the attribute of the time record, such as Regular or Overtime.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

timeBuildingBlockId.description: Unique identifier for the time record with specified attributes.

timeBuildingBlockVersion.description: Version number of the time record with specified attributes.

allowedException.description: Indicator that determines whether to allow the exception associated with the time record.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

messageCode.description: Code of the message associated with the time record, such as HWM_TDR_MISSING_IN_ERR for a missing in time entry error.

messageId.description: Unique identifier for the message associated with the time record.

messageText.description: Text of the message associated with the time record.

ruleId.description: Unique identifier of the rule from which messages were generated.

ruleSetId.description: Unique identifier of the rule set containing the rules from which messages were generated.

ruleSetType.description: Type of the rule set containing the rules from which messages were generated, such as TCR for time calculation rule.

severity.description: Severity of the message associated with the time record.

tag.description: Label attached to the message related to the time record for identification.

timeBuildingBlockId.description: Unique identifier for the time record with specified messages.

timeBuildingBlockVersion.description: Version number of the time record with specified messages.

timeMessageTokens.description:
The timeMessageTokens resource is a child of the time messages resource, and hence the child of child of the time records resource. it is a unique identifier for the token of the message associated with the time record.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
timeMessageTokens.title: Time Message Tokens

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

messageId.description: Unique identifier for the message of the defined token.

messageTokenId.description: Unique identifier for the message token.

tokenName.description: Name of the token for the message associated with the time record.

tokenValue.description: Value of the token for the message associated with the time record.

displayValue.description: Value displayed for the status of the time record, such as Approved.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

statusCode.description: Code of the status of the time record, such as A_APP_STATUS_PYR which is the code for the APPROVED status.

statusId.description: Unique identifier for the status of the time record.

statusName.description: Name of the status of the time record, such as Payroll Approval Entries Status.

statusValue.description: Value of the status of the time record, such as APPROVED.

timeBuildingBlockId.description: Unique identifier for the time record with specified status.

timeBuildingBlockVersion.description: Version number of the time record with specified status.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the order of the result set. A valid order by query would be: timeEventRequestId desc. For example : timeEventRequestId desc,sourceId asc

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query.Simple Comparisons (=,!=,>,<,>=,<=,AND) are supported. For example where=timeEventRequestId>=3 and timeEventRequestId<5 and sourceId=ORA_HWM_WEBCLOCK

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The following table describes the body parameters in the request for this task.

deviceId.description: Identifier for the time collection device used to create the time event.

eventDateTime.description: Date and time when the time event was recorded on the time collection device. The time stamp in the request must use the ISO 8601 standard with the timezone offset information. The attribute can handle either a start or end time or a start time and duration.

links.description: Link Relations
links.title: Items

reporterId.description: Identifier for the worker recording the time event on the time collection device.

reporterIdType.description: The type of reporter identifier, such as Person or Badge, that the time reporter uses when swiping on the time collection device. Valid values are defined in the list ReporterIDTypeList1.

supplierDeviceEvent.description: The time events recognized by the supplier that are mapped to the corresponding Workforce Management application event. For example, the supplier device event Clock In is mapped to the application event In. Valid values are defined in the lookup TimeLookupSharedAM_OraHwmTcdSupplierEventswithSource1 and the lookup codes are defined by the customer.

timeEventAttributes.description:
The timeEventAttributes resource is a child of the time events resource, and hence the child of child of the time events requests resource. It is a qualifier associated with the time event that reflects how time is paid, costed, billed, or recorded as an information entry. For example, the payroll time type attribute indicates if the time for payroll consumers must be paid.
This resource is currently under controlled availability.
timeEventAttributes.title: Time Event Attributes

timeEventId.description: Unique identifier for the IN or OUT time event that the time reporter records on a time collection device.

timeEventRequestId.description: Unique identifier for the time event request that the time collection device supplier sends. This request can contain one or more time events.
